name: Brown Rice & Vegetable Lunch Bowl
instructions: Rinse the brown rice and place it in a pot with water according to package directions. Cook until tender.
Meanwhile, chop broccoli, slice carrots, and dice the onion.
In a separate pot or pan, sauté the onions, carrots, and broccoli until slightly softened.
Add the canned tomatoes to the vegetables and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve the cooked brown rice in bowls, top with the vegetable mixture, and season to taste.
author: dietician

name: Quinoa & Chickpea Spinach Salad
instructions: Rinse and cook quinoa according to package directions. Let it cool slightly.
Drain and rinse the chickpeas.
In a large bowl, combine chopped tomatoes, diced onions, and fresh spinach.
Add the quinoa and chickpeas to the bowl.
Toss everything together and season to taste before serving.
author: dietician

name: Spaghetti with Canned Chicken & Broccoli
instructions: Cook spaghetti in boiling water according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
Steam or sauté the chopped broccoli and sliced carrots until tender.
Drain the canned chicken and shred it slightly with a fork if needed.
In a saucepan, warm the pasta sauce and stir in the chicken, broccoli, and carrots.
Combine the sauce mixture with the cooked spaghetti and serve.
author: dietician

name: Tuna & Veggie Tortilla Wrap
instructions: Drain the canned tuna and place in a bowl.
Stir in sliced onions (as desired) and season to taste.
Warm the tortillas briefly if desired.
Layer shredded lettuce, tuna mixture, and cheddar cheese on each tortilla.
Roll up the wrap and slice in half to serve.
author: dietician

name: Creamy Lentil & Vegetable Soup
instructions: Rinse the lentils thoroughly.
In a large pot, sauté diced onions and sliced carrots until slightly softened.
Add the broth and lentils; bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer.
Stir in the canned tomatoes and let the soup continue to simmer until lentils are tender.
Blend some or all of the soup (optional) for a creamy texture. Season to taste.
author: dietician

name: Baked Salmon & Potatoes with Bell Peppers
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Lightly mash the canned salmon in a bowl and mix with mustard. Set aside.
Chop potatoes into bite-sized pieces and slice bell peppers and onions.
Place potatoes, peppers, and onions on a baking sheet. Drizzle with oil (if available) and season to taste.
Bake the vegetables for about 20 minutes, then add the salmon mixture on top and bake an additional 10 minutes.
author: dietician

name: Black Bean & Corn Quesadillas
instructions: Soak and cook black beans ahead of time (or use canned black beans if available).
Heat a pan over medium heat. Place one tortilla in the pan.
Spread black beans, corn, chopped bell peppers, and shredded cheese on top of the tortilla.
Cover with another tortilla and cook until the cheese melts, flipping carefully to brown both sides.
Slice into wedges and serve warm.
author: dietician

name: Veggie Couscous Bowl
instructions: Cook couscous according to package instructions and fluff with a fork.
In a pan, sauté sliced zucchini until tender.
Add canned tomatoes (drained if preferred) and spinach; cook until spinach wilts.
Combine the couscous with the vegetable mixture in a bowl.
Sprinkle with seeds before serving.
author: dietician

name: Chicken Chili with Rice
instructions: Cook white rice according to package directions.
In a pot, sauté diced onions and chopped bell peppers until softened.
Add the canned chili and canned corn; simmer for 10 minutes.
Serve the chili mixture over the cooked rice.
author: dietician

name: Macaroni & Cheese with Broccoli
instructions: Cook macaroni in boiling water according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
Steam or sauté the chopped broccoli and diced onions until tender.
In a saucepan, warm the milk and gradually add shredded cheddar cheese, stirring until melted.
Combine cooked macaroni, broccoli, and onions with the cheese sauce.
Season to taste before serving.
author: dietician

name: Baked Eggs with Spinach & Onions
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Sauté diced onions until translucent, then add spinach to wilt.
Transfer spinach and onions to a small baking dish.
Crack eggs on top of the vegetables. Tear cheese slices into smaller pieces and place on top.
Bake for 10-15 minutes, or until eggs are set to your liking.
author: dietician

name: Peanut Butter & Chickpea Curry
instructions: Sauté diced onions and sliced carrots until slightly softened.
Add the drained chickpeas and stir for a minute.
Pour in the tomato sauce and bring to a gentle simmer.
Stir in peanut butter until fully incorporated, creating a creamy sauce.
Continue simmering until carrots are tender. Season to taste before serving.
author: dietician

name: Chicken Tortilla Soup
instructions: Sauté diced onions in a pot until translucent.
Add canned chicken (drained) and stir for a minute.
Pour in chicken broth and canned tomatoes; bring to a boil, then reduce heat.
Simmer for about 10-15 minutes, seasoning as desired.
Top each bowl with tortilla strips before serving.
author: dietician

name: Lentil & Potato Stew
instructions: Rinse lentils and set aside.
In a large pot, sauté onions and carrots until slightly softened.
Add chopped potatoes, lentils, and vegetable broth.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer until lentils and potatoes are tender.
Season to taste and serve hot.
author: dietician

name: Pinto Beans & Rice
instructions: Soak and cook pinto beans in advance, or use canned pinto beans if available.
Cook white rice according to package directions.
Sauté diced onions until translucent, then add the cooked pinto beans and canned tomatoes.
Simmer for 10 minutes, seasoning as desired.
Serve the bean mixture over a bed of hot white rice.
author: dietician

name: Baked Egg & Vegetable Frittata
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, sauté onions and bell peppers until slightly softened.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted.
Whisk eggs in a bowl and stir in shredded cheddar cheese.
Combine sautéed vegetables with the egg mixture, pour into a baking dish, and bake for 15–20 minutes or until eggs are set.
author: dietician

name: Tuna, Rice & Broccoli Casserole
instructions: Cook brown rice according to package directions.
Lightly steam or blanch chopped broccoli.
In a bowl, mix drained tuna, cooked rice, broccoli, and milk.
Transfer mixture to a baking dish and top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 20 minutes or until cheese is melted and casserole is heated through.
author: dietician

name: Quinoa with Cauliflower & Chickpeas
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions and set aside.
Sauté diced onions, then add cauliflower florets and cook until they begin to soften.
Stir in drained chickpeas and tomato sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Fold in the cooked quinoa and let warm through.
Season to taste before serving.
author: dietician

name: Macaroni Chili Bake
instructions: Cook macaroni in boiling water according to package directions; drain.
Sauté diced onions until translucent.
In a baking dish, combine cooked macaroni, canned chili, and sautéed onions.
Top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 20 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and the dish is heated through.
author: dietician

name: Peanut Butter & Lentil Curry
instructions: Rinse lentils and set aside.
Sauté diced onions until translucent.
Add lentils, vegetable broth, and canned tomatoes; bring to a boil, then lower heat to simmer.
Stir in peanut butter and mix well for a creamy texture.
Cook until lentils are tender and sauce thickens. Season as desired.
author: dietician

name: Quick Chicken Pasta Salad
instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
Season the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and any desired herbs. Cook in a pan over medium heat until fully cooked. Slice into strips.
In a mixing bowl, combine the cooked pasta, sliced chicken, salad, diced tomato, and cooked rice.
For the dressing, mix together olive oil, balsamic vinegar, salt, pepper, and any other desired seasonings. Toss the salad with the dressing until well combined.
Serve the quick chicken pasta salad chilled or at room temperature.
author: AI Chef

name: Chicken Pasta Salad with Tomato Rice Crepes
instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions and set aside.
Season the chicken breast with salt, pepper, and any desired spices. Cook in a pan until fully cooked, then slice into strips.
Prepare the salad with your choice of ingredients and dressing.
Cook the rice in a pot with water until fluffy.
For the easy crepe, mix rice flour, water, and a pinch of salt to create a thin batter. Pour a ladleful onto a non-stick pan and spread it to form a thin crepe. Cook until golden brown on both sides.
Top the crepe with diced tomatoes, chicken strips, and a spoonful of pasta. Roll it up and serve alongside the salad.
Enjoy your Chicken Pasta Salad with Tomato Rice Crepes!
author: AI Chef

name: Simple Bean and Vegetable Rice
instructions: 1. Cook the rice according to package instructions.
2. In a pan, heat the canned beans and vegetables together until heated through.
3. Serve the bean and vegetable mixture over the cooked rice.
author: AI Chef

name: Test Recipe
instructions: Blay Blah Blyat Blayt
author: AI Chef

name: Peanut Butter Lentil Couscous Salad
instructions: In a large bowl, mix the cooked green lentils and couscous.
In a separate small bowl, combine the creamy peanut butter and dehydrated poultry broth stock. Mix well until smooth and pour over the lentil-couscous mixture. Stir to combine.
Let the salad sit for 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
Serve chilled or at room temperature. Enjoy!
author: AI Chef

name: Salmon and Cheese Wraps
instructions: 1. Heat the tortilla wraps in a pan or microwave until warm.
2. In a separate pan, heat the salmon, sweet corn, and sliced beets until warm.
3. Place a slice of American cheese on each tortilla wrap.
4. Add the salmon, sweet corn, and sliced beets mixture on top of the cheese.
5. Roll up the tortilla wraps and secure with toothpicks if needed.
6. Serve and enjoy!
author: AI Chef

name: Salmon and Cheese Tortilla Wraps
instructions: 1. Drain the canned Wild Alaska Pink Salmon and shred it into smaller pieces.
2. Lay out the White Tortilla Wraps and divide the Sweet corn cream, shredded salmon, Singles American Cheese Slices, and Sliced Beets evenly among them.
3. Roll up the tortillas tightly and place them on a heated pan or griddle to cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side until the cheese is melted and the tortilla is crispy.
4. Cut the wraps in half and serve hot.
servings
author: AI Chef

name: Southwest Chili with Basmati Rice
instructions: 1. In a pan, heat the Canned Chili With Beans over medium heat.
2. In a separate pot, cook the Basmati rice according to package instructions.
3. Add the Del Monte Whole kernel corn to the chili and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
4. Serve the chili over the cooked Basmati rice.
5. Enjoy your Southwest Chili with Basmati Rice!
author: AI Chef

name: Creamy Chickpea and Chicken Mac and Cheese
instructions: 1. Cook the Barilla Penne Rigate Fullkorn pasta according to package instructions.
2. In a separate pan, heat the canned chickpeas, diced chicken breast, and canned chicken breast with some chicken broth over medium heat.
3. Add in the cooked pasta and stir in the Mac and Cheese Original Flavor until well combined.
4. Mix in the green lentils, Dijon mustard, and a splash of Fairlife milk for creaminess. Let it simmer for another 5 minutes.
5. Serve hot and enjoy!
author: AI Chef
